titleStmt.title: The Spanish masquerado VVherein vnder a pleasant deuise, is discouered effectuallie, in certaine breefe sentences and mottos, the pride and insolencie of the Spanish estate: with the disgrace conceiued by their losse, and the dismaied confusion of their tronbled [sic] thoughtes. Whereunto by the author, for the better vnderstanding of his deuice, is added a breefe glosse. By Robert Greene, in Artibus Magister. ...
titleStmt.author: Greene, Robert, 1558?-1592.
Nash, Thomas, 1567-1601.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Roger Ward, for Thomas Cadman,

notesStmt.note: In this edition A2r is signed "Robert Greene" in italic; only sections 11 and 12 are numbered in the text. Quire A outer forme and most of E inner forme are in the same setting as STC 12309.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
